update.description:
* If models are scaled while recording a log, the scaling doesn't get recorded. This pull request makes it so the scaling is properly reproduced.

* This will also be needed to undo/redo scaling commands

* Needs [SDF pull request #246](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/246/add-scale-to-model-state/diff)

* [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/68/) ok

content.raw:
can you take a look at 99124f5?  I quickly tested a different approach that avoids undoing the model scale when saving the world. The Model's scale variable is updated directly when loading ModelState and the scaled models seems to be load ok now. 

The new integration tests do not pass because I think it expects the model to be unscaled.
content.html:
can you take a look at 99124f5? I quickly tested a different approach that avoids undoing the model scale when saving the world. The Model's scale variable is updated directly when loading ModelState and the scaled models seems to be load ok now.

The new integration tests do not pass because I think it expects the model to be unscaled.

pullrequest.title: User scaling commands are properly logged and played back

content.raw:
It depends on how much precision you want. The ignition `<<` operators always use 6 digits of precision.

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Vector3.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Vector3.hh-701
content.html:
It depends on how much precision you want. The ignition << operators always use 6 digits of precision.

  • https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Vector3.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Vector3.hh-701

content.raw:
I think the test is not as much of a problem as the solution is. I briefly talked about this with @iche033 and I think we haven't got to a conclusion about what the ideal behaviour would be.

The main problem is that under certain circumstances, changing the scale is actually changing the geometry.
content.html:
I think the test is not as much of a problem as the solution is. I briefly talked about this with @iche033 and I think we haven't got to a conclusion about what the ideal behaviour would be.

The main problem is that under certain circumstances, changing the scale is actually changing the geometry.

pullrequest.title: User scaling commands are properly logged and played back

content.raw:
I'll be picking this up soon.

Just for the record, the quickest way to reproduce the issue is:

1. Scale some shapes

1. Save the world

1. Reload the world - the scale will be applied twice.

This is happening because when we save we modify the shape's size. So now with states, the scale ends up being applied twice.
content.html:
I'll be picking this up soon.

Just for the record, the quickest way to reproduce the issue is:

  1. Scale some shapes

  2. Save the world

  3. Reload the world - the scale will be applied twice.

This is happening because when we save we modify the shape's size. So now with states, the scale ends up being applied twice.
